dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This tool creates an NHA Core and Supporting from selected CPP Cores. First, make sure you are editing your version of the NHA geodatabase. Then, select the CPPs that will be part of the NHA Core.

The selected CPPs are merged together, appended to the NHA Core, and attributes are calculated for that record. Then, new records are added to the species table for each element occurrence that is included in the NHA. Using the EO IDs in the selected CPP Cores, the appropriate CPP Supportings are selected, merged, appended to the NHA Supporting, and attributes calculated.

tool.name: CreateNHA

param.name: site_name
param.dialogReference: Type the site name for this NHA.

param.name: cpp_core
param.dialogReference: Select the CPPs that will be included in the NHA. Then choose the layer from the drop down list or drag and drop the layer from the Table of Contents. Do NOT navigate to the PNHP database via the file folder, then the tool will run on the whole feature class instead of the selection.

param.name: nha_core
param.dialogReference: Choose your version of the NHA Core Habitat from the drop down list or drag and drop the layer from the Table of Contents. The final NHA Core will be appended to this layer.

param.name: nha_slp
param.dialogReference: Choose your version of the NHA Supporting Landscape from the drop down list or drag and drop the layer from the Table of Contents. The final NHA Supporting will be appended to this layer.

param.name: spec_tbl
param.dialogReference: Choose your version of the species table from the drop down list or drag and drop the layer from the Table of Contents. The new species records will be appended to this table.

param.name: exclude_cpps
param.displayname: Exclude CPPs marked 'not approved' or 'problematic source feature'
param.dialogReference: The tool by default excludes CPPs marked 'not approved' or 'problematic source feature'. Uncheck this box to include those CPPs.

tool.summary:
This tool creates an NHA Core and Supporting from selected CPP Cores. First, make sure you are editing your version of the NHA geodatabase. Then, select the CPPs that will be part of the NHA Core.

The selected CPPs are merged together, appended to the NHA Core, and attributes are calculated for that record. Then, new records are added to the species table for each element occurrence that is included in the NHA. Using the EO IDs in the selected CPP Cores, the appropriate CPP Supportings are selected, merged, appended to the NHA Supporting, and attributes calculated.
